name: Weeping Cherry
climate: Prefers temperate climates with distinct seasons throughout the year.
Thrives in regions where winters are cool and summers are warm.
Can tolerate a range of climates but does best in USDA zones 5-8.
Avoids extremes of cold or heat, needing moderate conditions to flourish.
sunlight: Requires full sun for at least six to eight hours daily to bloom well.
Can tolerate light shadow but primarily flourishes in bright conditions.
Growth and flower production diminish significantly without ample sunlight.
Placed in a location where it can receive abundant morning sunlight exposure.
watering: Needs regular watering to establish roots within the first few months.
Enjoys consistently moist soil but not waterlogged or oversaturated.
In dry periods, supplemental watering is required to prevent stress.
During the growing season, watering frequency may need to be increased.
soil: Prefers well-draining soil rich in organic matter and nutrients.
Tolerates a range of soil types but thrives in loamy, fertile soil.
Avoids water-retentive or heavy clay soils that can cause root rot.
Ensure the planting site is adequately amended to promote drainage.
extra_care_tip: Prune during late winter to early spring to maintain shape and remove dead branches.
Mulching around the base helps retain moisture and suppresses weed growth.
